meanings.definition: The quality or state of being frontal.
meanings.sent1: The frontalities of the building were impressive, with its grand entrance and tall columns.
meanings.sent2: She admired the frontalities of the painting, especially the intricate details on the front.
meanings.sent3: The frontalities of the cat's stare made it seem like it was staring into your soul.
meanings.sent4: His honesty had a certain frontalities to it, cutting through any pretense or deception.
meanings.sent5: The frontalities of the mountain range were breathtaking, stretching out before us like a majestic wall.

meanings.definition: The front part or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The car's frontalities were damaged in the accident, requiring extensive repairs.
meanings.sent2: She carefully examined the frontalities of the book, noting the intricate cover design.
meanings.sent3: The frontalities of the cake were beautifully decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The ship's frontalities gleamed in the sunlight as it sailed into the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The frontalities of the house were adorned with blooming flowers, welcoming visitors with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The position directly ahead or in front.
meanings.sent1: He always took the frontalities in meetings, eager to be at the forefront of discussions.
meanings.sent2: The runner sprinted towards the finish line, aiming for the frontalities of the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the frontalities of the window seat, basking in the warm sunlight.
meanings.sent4: She faced the frontalities of the challenge head-on, determined to overcome any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The leader stood at the frontalities of the parade, waving to the cheering crowd.
